data.title: When multiple instances are opened on different git repos, only one will enable the git features.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:01:14.464Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-75-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.3|
|vscode-random|jrebocho|1.3.0|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.0|
|vscode-input-sequence|tomoki1207|0.2.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. On a new instance of VS Code, open a git repo root folder. VS Code will show the current branch name in the status bar and enable all the git commands.
2. Start another instance of VS Code (different than the first) and open a different git repo root folder. This instance will not enable the git commands and ui indications. This is not a problem with the repo; if they're opened in different order, the problem still occurs - the second instance of VS Code will not enable it's git features.


Expected: that different instances of VS code can work on different git repos at the same time.

data.title: List: bad color when focus moves out of selection and hovering
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

0. light theme
1. select something in extensions viewlet
2. arrow down
3. hover over the selected entry

=> the color turns into some gray tone

Looks like this fix would do it in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/browser/ui/list/listWidget.ts#L813:

		if (styles.listActiveSelectionBackground) {
			content.push(`.monaco-list.${this.idPrefix}:focus .monaco-list-row.selected { background-color: ${styles.listActiveSelectionBackground}; }`);
			content.push(`.monaco-list.${this.idPrefix}:focus .monaco-list-row.selected:hover { background-color: ${styles.listActiveSelectionBackground}; }`); // overwrite :hover style in this case!
		}

data.title: 'Checking For Updates...' is grayed out and an update message is never shown on Windows

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.12.0-insider (48ae6e3027be560d45dd1ebfbe090d6ff77af7f0, 2017-04-26T06:13:08.212Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.16179
---

Often on Windows (most of the time, but I don't think 100%), I find that I never get the update notification that an update is ready. And when I go to look at the Help menu, the `Checking For Updates...` item is grayed out and no matter how long I wait it never seems to recover until I completely restart vscode. Once I restart vscode and wait a bit (30s or more) then it will show the update notification.

This might be related to: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/17159 but I don't get any crash or anything -- just the lack of update notification.

This also only seems to happen with the auto-update, not if I manually choose `Check For Updates...`

data.title: Word Wrap Not Staying Enabled
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.0.2|
|mssql|ms-mssql|0.3.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.9.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.12.2|
|oracle-plsql|mycelo|1.0.3|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.6.0|
|vscode-sql-beautify|sensourceinc|0.0.4|;
---
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Opened 4 different documents
2. Selected Document 1
3. Enabled Word-Wrap on Document 1
4. Paste in code on Document 1 (word wrap successful)
5. Selected a document 2
6. Alter anything
7. Select Document 1 paste in additional code (word wrap unsuccessful)

Word wrap must be re enabled again.

data.title: Configurable extensions server (feature request)
data.body:
In high-security environments one cannot download extensions or binaries freely. Those have to be provided from a central repo for organization. (I cannot even download extensions in my VSCode directly - DNS resolution is unavailable on my laptop for anything but an administratively locked-down browser).

It would be nice to have an option to configure extensions server URL in VSCode so that organization-wide server with extensions could be set up. 

Please consider adding such feature to VSCode.

data.title: Intellisense ranking issue
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.12.0-insider (31a5fb236ddeed969a0021a2f94e7695ffbfb66b, 2017-04-28T06:13:22.707Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.0|
|gitignore|codezombiech|0.5.0|
|bracket-pair-colorizer|CoenraadS|0.10.3|
|tslint|eg2|0.12.0|
|vscode-postfix-ts|ipatalas|1.3.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Using the `postfix` extension, entries are added to intellisense such as `log`
2. But ranking doesn't seem to order them correctly

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5593825/25537871/98b0d8d8-2c40-11e7-886d-8ccd7022cfae.png)

I would expect `log` to be topmost, so I can just press enter without having to navigate the menu.

data.title: Debug multiple ASP.NET Core projects in Visual Studio Code
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

I have the following ASP.NET Core solution (solution.sln) structure in VS Code:

    .vscode
      launch.json
      tasks.json
    src/
      api/
        api.csproj
      web/
        web.csproj
    test/
      api.test/
        api.test.csproj    
    solution.sln

I need to debug both api.csproj and web.csproj so I added the launch.json:

    {
      "version": "0.2.0",
      "configurations": [
        {
          "name": "Api",
          "type": "coreclr",
          "request": "launch",
          "preLaunchTask": "build",
          "program": "${workspaceRoot}/src/api/bin/Debug/netcoreapp1.1/api.dll",
          "args": [],
          "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}/src/api",
          "stopAtEntry": false,
          "console": "internalConsole"
        },
        {
          "name": "Web",
          "type": "coreclr",
          "request": "launch",
          "preLaunchTask": "build",
          "program": "${workspaceRoot}/src/web/bin/Debug/netcoreapp1.1/Web.dll",
          "args": [],
          "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}/src/web",
          "stopAtEntry": false,
          "launchBrowser": {
            "enabled": true,
            "args": "${auto-detect-url}",
            "windows": {
              "command": "cmd.exe",
              "args": "/C start ${auto-detect-url}"
            },
            "osx": {
              "command": "open"
            },
            "linux": {
              "command": "xdg-open"
            }
          },
          "env": {
            "ASPNETCORE_ENVIRONMENT": "Development"
          },
          "sourceFileMap": {
            "/Views": "${workspaceRoot}/src/api/views"
          }
        }
      ]
    } 

And the following tasks.json:

    {
      "version": "0.1.0",
      "command": "dotnet",
      "isShellCommand": true,
      "args": [],
      "tasks": [
        {
          "taskName": "build",
          "args": ["Api", "Web"],
          "isBuildCommand": true,
          "showOutput": "always",
          "problemMatcher": "$msCompile"
        }
      ]
    }  

But when I debug it I get the following error:

    MSBUILD : error MSB1008: Only one project can be specified.

I have tried different options but I always end with some kind of error some not even related with MSBUILD.

What is the proper way to debug multiple ASP.NET CORE projects in Visual Studio Code?

data.title: Diff editor: avoid hardcoded modified-side shadow
data.body:
Inside diffEditor.css I see a rule for setting the shadow color between left hand and right hand side of the diff editor:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/25531932/ad420a52-2c2b-11e7-9a3c-f8d5084f3b83.png)

I suggest to remove this rule and use the `scrollbar.shadow` color instead.

[SCSS] Reporting errors when code is correct
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new `scss` file
2. Paste code below

```css
$map: (
  a: (63px, 70px),
  b: (100px, 69px),
  c: (70px, 70px),
  d: (79px, 70px),
);

@each $prop, $sizes in $map {
  .c--#{$prop} {
    width: nth($sizes, 1);
    height: nth($sizes, 2);
    background-image: url('./media/' + $prop + '.png');
    background-image: url('./media/' + $prop + '@2x.png');
    background-image: url('./media/' + $prop + '@3x.png');
  }
}
```

Expected behaviour
```
No errors reported
```

Current behaviour

![zrzut ekranu 2017-04-28 o 12 54 51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1313605/25526000/ea18d4ca-2c11-11e7-85a4-c04ff245767c.png)

Code is valid

![zrzut ekranu 2017-04-28 o 12 58 23](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1313605/25526118/6cb66c4e-2c12-11e7-8ce1-3facd4599ce2.png)

data.title: Support to attach to an electron spawned node process using the picker

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Currently you cannot attach to an electron spawned node process like the TypeScript server using the picker, that is using a launch config like:
```json
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "attach",
            "name": "Attach to process",
            "processId": "${command:PickProcess}",
            "port": 5859,
            "protocol": "legacy"

        }
```

data.title: Make use of tslib
data.body: TypeScript generates lots of helpers for inheritance et al. They bloat up our code. We have some fragile regex tricks to remove unnecessary code. Since TypeScript support has gotten a lot better we should make use of `tslib` and the new emit flags

data.title: Could not run on CentOS 7 with x2go
data.body:
I have installed the latest version of VS Code on CnetOS 7. 
However when I try to run VS Code, it loads for some time trying to open, but then nothing happens, no errors, nothing.
I have tried to installed both trough rpm package and zipped files, but got the same result in both cases.

I'm using x2go to connect to my CentOS 7.

data.title: Please support large files in VS Code editor
data.body:
Please enable VS Code to open large files (e.g. size about 100 MB).  It is needed for  working with log files (in debugging and tuning activities). The support for binary files would be appreciated as well. Thank you. Ivan

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Microsoft Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a large text file 
2. You will get message "The file will not be displayed in the editor becouse it is either binary, very large or uses an unsupported text encoding." insted of the file's content.

data.title: -n and --new-window flags do not seem to be working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.11.2 (1.11.2)
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open an instance of code from the command line `code .`
2. open a second instance of code for the same directory using the `--new-window` flag (`code --new-window .`

I seem to get the same window again. These flags are documented [here](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/command-line)

I get this same behaviour when debugging an extension locally

```
{
    "name": "Launch Extension",
    "type": "extensionHost",
    "request": "launch",
    "runtimeExecutable": "${execPath}",
    "args": ["--new-window", "/Users/lbatchelor/test-directory", "--extensionDevelopmentPath=${workspaceRoot}" ],
    "stopOnEntry": false
},
```

data.title: Indentation fails for ruby files
data.body:
All of a sudden the indentation fails for ruby (.rb) files fails. I'm using the vim plugin (0.6.20) and marking a part of the code and then pressing "=" that auto indents code nothing happens. This worked fine just a while ago.

It seems to work fine for javascript files (.js) but not .rb files.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. shift-v <mark a part of the code>
2. shift-0 (=) to indent marked code.
 
- I've tried with standard settings
- I've deactivated plugins (except vim plugin)
- I've restarted vsscode
- Updated VIM plugin to latest version

data.title: QuickOpen enhancement request
data.body:
When using QuickEdit to open a file you can use _CTRL+1_ to open a file, _CTRL+2_ to open a file to another viewpanel and _CTRL+3_ to open yet another file on the 3rd viewpanel.

Now when you want to QuickEdit open other files to any of the open viewpanels, one would think you
can continue using _CTRL+1, 2 or 3_ to send them to their respective viewpanel but this is not the case!
The only thing you can do is QuickEdit _CTRL+ENTER_ and it will open the file in de 2nd viewpanel (always, disregarding the viewpanel you opened QuickEdit).
